p: Considering singles n-6 PUFA, increasing amounts of defatted BSF larvae meal into layersâ€™ diets significantly lowered the C18:2 n-6 ( p < 0.001) and C20:4 n-6 ( p < 0.05) proportions. The reduction of the overall n-3 percentage with increasing the dietary incorporation of defatted BSF larvae meal, was due to the reduction of C18:3 n-3 ( p < 0.001) and of C22:6 n-3 ( p < 0.001) FA, whereas the C20:3 n-3 followed an opposite trend: 0.16 vs. 0.18 vs. 0.20% of total FAME for Control, BSF10, BSF15, respectively ( p < 0.05).
